column1: gives himself some room, but Imad follows him, a length ball outside leg stump, the batsman pushes at it, gets an outside which runs past the keeper
and he strikes first ball, the stumps are in disarray. Length ball, pitching outside off and angling in to beat the bat and the middle stump is out of its groove
fuller around off, looks to drive it through extra cover, gets an outside edge past the first slip
fuller around off, Charles comes forward and swipes it across and gets a boundary to deep midwicket. Not from the middle of the bat and was in the air for quite a while but lands in the gap
Shinwari strikes again! This time it's Johnson Charles. Fuller around off, Charles goes for a slog and misses, Shinwari doesn't and finds the off stump
short of length outside off, stands tall and punches it towards backward point, a partial stop there allows a single

length ball on the leg stump, Vince looks to work it on the leg side, misses and the ball brushes the pads and goes between the keeper and first slip. An appeal for lbw but given not-out. Maybe just pitched outside leg
Malik makes some room and cut through backward point
Vince clears his front leg and drives through extra cover
Vince clears front leg again looking to sweep in the air over midwicket, misses it completely
Malik charges Umer Khan and drives straight down the ground, beating long-off
Hammad slices to deep cover, Colin Ingram drops a sitter
Shoaib Malik charges Umer again, holes to long-on. A simple catch for Babar Azam
Christian guides the ball to third man, fielder chasing can't quite keep the ball from reaching the boundary
Christian scoops to extra cover, Aaron Summers completes a sharp, one handed diving catch. The umpires are checking if the catch is clean and they think it is
Hammad Azam glances to square leg for a boundary
Hammad Azam reads a poor slower delivery wide of off. Sets himself up to blast over extra cover

Hammad Azam misses a full toss that crashed into his leg, above the knee. He's given lbw, but he was in enough pain he would probably have retired hurt anyway. Strangely enough, they still reviewed but that stays out
Shinwari cleans up the top of middle to send Irfan back for a golden duck
Chris Green top-edges one above the keeper's head for four
Green clears front leg and slashes through extra cover
Babar picks up the short ball early and pulls it to midwicket
slapped over mid-off
Babar slashes through point, with Mohammad Irfan failing to cut it off at the boundary
Munro top edges. Goes straight up in the air, Mohammad Ilyas completes a simple caught and bowled
Livingstone inside edges to fine leg
Livingstone flat-bats straight down the ground for four
Livingstone inside edge narrowly misses the stumps, goes for four
Babar walks across, gets struck on the pad in front of middle. Given out but he decides to review it. Stays out and Kings lose their second wicket
Ingram helps the ball to fine leg for four
Ingram reverse sweeps, beats third man
Long hop from Irfan. Ingram lofts past fine leg
another long hop. Livingstone gets underneath it and smashes one bounce to the midwicket boundary
Ingram sweeps fine, beats fine leg, who was up in the circle
tries to pull it in front of square, misjudges the bounce, and the ball clips the top of leg
nicks to the keeper as he looks to drive it through the covers
Livingstone slashes it to the square-leg boundary
Rizwan smacks a slower ball straight to cow corner
over the cow corner, finishes off the game
